item.title: Robocup Asia-Pacific @ Dubai
item.description: In December 1st we were told by our CS teacher that there will be a Robocup held in Dubai, I was really intrested and since the material they introduced was mostly graphical with some Arduino code in it, I decided to join although I had limited experience in both of these subjects. The school created a workshop + election process at friday, which consisted of using the code to run virtual robots in an area, which was powered by Microsoft Robotics suit and Nvidia PhysX.

item.title: About
item.description: Works: Mentor at Google Code-in 2019 System Administrator at Tehran Internet Co. Exhibitor at Dubai Knowledge and Human Development Authority Ranked 5th in the National Cyber Olympiad Fedora Project Contributor Certified Online Tutor and E-lecture Designer by HBMSU Intrests: Swimming & biking Writing (Essay, Documentation) Coding & Designing Photography Languages: Persian (Native) English (Fluent) Arabic (familiar) German (Familiar) You can find more info about me in my Linkedin, I post updates there.

item.title: Photographs
item.description: Here you can see my shots, for obvious reasons they are heavily compressed here. Full Image gallery in 500px Tehran - Chitgar Park FiruzKuh - Zarindasht FiruzKuh - HableRud Dubai - DubaiMall
